discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
"User and entity behavior analytics (UEBA) is a cybersecurity solution that uses algorithms and machine learning to detect anomalies in the behavior of not only the users in a corporate network but also the routers, servers, and endpoints in that network."
Who picks these answers? SOAR? Wtf

comments.content: Agreed, this is the best answer here.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
UEBA (User and Entity Behavior Analytics) is a cybersecurity solution that focuses on analyzing the behavior of users and entities (such as machines, applications, and devices) within an organization's network to detect potential security threats.
UEBA is often used in combination with other cybersecurity solutions, such as SIEM (Security Information and Event Management), threat intelligence, and endpoint protection, to provide a comprehensive security posture for organizations

Selected Answer: C
The MOST appropriate product category for identifying malicious actions by users as part of an insider threat program is option C, UEBA (User and Entity Behavior Analytics).

UEBA is a security product category that uses machine learning and artificial intelligence techniques to analyze user and entity behavior for the purpose of detecting insider threats. UEBA products can identify unusual or malicious behavior by users and entities, such as data exfiltration, unauthorized access, and changes to access permissions.

Selected Answer: C
C. EUBA - entity and user behavioral analytics

questions.question_text: A security engineer is reviewing security products that identify malicious actions by users as part of a company's insider threat program Which of the following is the MOST appropriate product category for this purpose?
A security analyst discovers the companyâ€™s website is vulnerable to cross-site scripting. Which of the following solutions will BEST remedy the vulnerability?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Server-side input validation

Selected Answer: C
The answer is C. Client-Side Input encoding is done using JavaScript and provides an additional layer of security to prevent XSS on the client side before reaching the server. Whereas, Server-Side Input Validation deals with SQL injections that are used to manipulate server-side databases.

Selected Answer: B
Defo B and here is why - https://www.packetlabs.net/posts/input-validation/#:~:text=Server%2Dside%20input%20validation%20will,vulnerable%20to%20Cross%2DSite%20Scripting.

Selected Answer: B
The BEST solution to remedy the cross-site scripting vulnerability on the company's website is option B, server-side input validation.

Server-side input validation involves checking user input on the server side to ensure that it meets expected criteria before it is processed or stored. This can prevent malicious code from being injected into the website and reduce the risk of cross-site scripting attacks.

comments.content: Agreed. Server side input validation is best here, to validate and sanitize input data.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Implementing input validation is NOT the best way to LOCATE THE ISSUE. It's a mitigation technique to reduce the likelihood of exploitation. 
D - static code analysis and code review is the way to go.

comments.content: I also agree. The question says the 'web form' was manipulated. I am not seeing how input validation would assist with the code on the web form being manipulated. Thus, Static code analysis should be the better option here.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
he best way to locate the issue of manipulation in the public-facing web form would be C. Implement input validation. This ensures that only properly formatted data is entered into the system, which can help prevent inconsistencies and manipulation.

Selected Answer: C
"manipulation of the public-facing WEB FORM"
Implement input validation on web forms (Both client and at server).

comments.content: Changing my answer to A. Question is about locating the issue, not fixing/remediation.
How would "Reduce the session timeout threshold" would locate the issue? Obviously, this is a poorly worded question but if we need to locate and not fix then D would be the best answer in this case.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D - I mean in what world would input validation be used to investigate or locate an issue? :)

"which would be the best to locate this issue" I think is the key here. 

While initially I thought it was input validation, that doesn't really help locate the issue but it does help mitigate it. I think the answer is D static code analysis. It will help help locate the insecure parameters that are likely being passed in the http request such as "item price" which are being manipulated by the user.

Selected Answer: C
C. Implement input validation.

Implementing input validation involves validating and sanitizing user input on the web form to ensure that only valid and expected data is accepted. This can help prevent malicious or unintended input, such as unauthorized changes to product prices.

By implementing input validation, you can enforce specific rules and constraints on the data entered by users, such as numerical values for prices, proper formatting, and other relevant criteria. This can help detect and reject any attempts to manipulate the form by entering incorrect or malicious pricing information.

Selected Answer: C
C. Implement input validation would be the BEST way to locate the issue of manipulation of the public-facing web form used by customers to order products.
Running a static code scan (Option D) may help to identify potential vulnerabilities in the source code of the web application, but it is not specific to the issue of manipulation of the web form. Static code scans are usually used to identify code-level vulnerabilities before the application is deployed, while the issue here is more likely to be a configuration or logic issue in the web form.
agree with D

Selected Answer: D
A static code scan is a type of code analysis that examines the source code of an application without actually executing it. This analysis can detect issues such as code injection vulnerabilities, cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities, and other security flaws.

In this case, the manipulation of the public-facing web form could be due to a vulnerability in the code of the web form. By running a static code scan, any vulnerabilities or weaknesses in the code could be identified, and appropriate remedial actions could be taken to fix the issue.

Selected Answer: D
D static code scan

Selected Answer: C
only viable answer!

Selected Answer: C
Implementing input validation on the web form used by customers to order products would be the best way to locate the issue of inconsistencies between the actual price of an item and the amount charged to the customer. Input validation involves checking the data entered by users and ensuring it meets certain criteria, such as proper format, data type, and length. By validating the input data, the security analyst can ensure that the user-entered data is in the correct format and does not contain any malicious payloads or tampering. This will help prevent the manipulation of the web form and reduce the risk of fraud and data breaches.

Selected Answer: C
Input validation is required

questions.question_text: During an audit, several customer order forms v/ere found to contain inconsistencies between the actual price of an item and the amount charged to the customer. Further investigation narrowed the cause of the issue to manipulation of the public-facing web form used by customers to order products. Which of the following would be the BEST way to locate this issue?

choices.B: Deploy MFA for access to the web server.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AB
The fact that examtopics have given us A and C is laughable seeing as they practically contradict eachother

comments.content: Agree with AB, this is the best two answers here, and can be deduced from just eliminating the answers that just don't fit.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AB
A. Train the security assessment team to evaluate the new language and verify that best practices for secure coding have been followed
B. Work with the automated assessment-tool vendor to add support for the new language so these vulnerabilities are discovered automatically

The solution will address the findings that the development team used a new software language that was not supported by the security team's automated assessment tools and the security assessment team was unfamiliar with the new language and struggled to evaluate the software during advanced testing. The training of the security assessment team and working with the automated assessment-tool vendor to add support for the new language will ensure that future deployments of the new technology are secure and the vulnerabilities are detected and prevented.

Selected Answer: AB
"To allow this new technology to be deployed securely going forward"
AB only logical answer

choices.B: Work with the automated assessment-tool vendor to add support for the new language so these vulnerabilities are discovered automatically
choices.A: Train the security assessment team to evaluate the new language and verify that best practices for secure coding have been followed
choices.C: Contact the human resources department to hire new security team members who are already familiar with the new language
choices.F: Outsource development and hosting of the applications in the new language to a third-party vendor so the risk is transferred to that provider
choices.E: Instruct only the development team to document the remediation steps for this vulnerability
choices.D: Run the software on isolated systems so when they are compromised, the attacker cannot pivot to adjacent systems

questions.question_text:
During a companyâ€™s most recent incident, a vulnerability in custom software was exploited on an externally facing server by an APT. The lessons-learned report noted the following:

â€¢ The development team used a new software language that was not supported by the security team's automated assessment tools.
â€¢ During the deployment, the security assessment team was unfamiliar with the new language and struggled to evaluate the software during advanced testing. Therefore, the vulnerability was not detected.
â€¢ The current IPS did not have effective signatures and policies in place to detect and prevent runtime attacks on the new application.

To allow this new technology to be deployed securely going forward, which of the following will BEST address these findings? (Choose two.)
